stanza.line: When in disgrace with Fortune and meneyes
I all alone beweep my outcast state
And trouble deaf heaven with my bootlesscries
And look upon my self and curse myfate
Wishing me like to one more rich inhope
Featured like him like him with friends possessed
Desiring this man art and that manscope
With what I most enjoy contented least
Yet in these thoughts my self almostdespising
Haply I think on thee and then mystate
Like to the lark at break of dayarising
From sullen earth sings hymns at heavengate
For thy sweet love remembered such wealthbrings
That then I scorn to change my state withkings
